page.title: 03MORTIMER FOREST
page.content: Mortimer Forest,lying to the west of Ludlow,once belonged the the de Mortimer family but is now administered by the Forestry Commission.The forest produces timber,most of which goes to pulp and saw mills.Morimers unique feature is it's long-coated fallow deer.Known nowhere else in the world,these deer differ from normal fallow in the length of their top hair which grows all over the body but especially long in ears and on tails. The public can use the forests several nature trails - the shortest is 2\km,the longest 24km.Other amenities include picnic sites and an observation platform inside an enclosure.From her rabbits ,grey squirrels,foxes,deer,birds and butterflies can be watched.
